action.action-desc: Mr. Gomez (for himself, Ms. Barragán, Mr. Blumenauer, Ms. Bonamici, Ms. Brown, Mr. Carbajal, Mr. Cárdenas, Mr. Carson, Mr. Casten, Ms. Chu, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Davis of Illinois, Mr. DeSaulnier, Mr. Espaillat, Mr. García of Illinois, Mr. Grijalva, Mr. Huffman, Ms. Jacobs, Ms. Lee of California, Mr. Levin, Mr. Morelle, Mr. Nadler, Mrs. Napolitano, Ms. Norton, Ms. Porter, Ms. Sánchez, Mr. Sarbanes, Ms. Schakowsky, Mr. Schiff, Mr. David Scott of Georgia, Mr. Smith of Washington, Mr. Thompson of California, Ms. Titus, Ms. Velázquez, Ms. Williams of Georgia, and Mr. Panetta) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To establish a program to award grants to entities that provide transportation connectors from critically underserved communities to green spaces, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Transit to Trails Act.

paragraph.text: The term community of color means a geographically distinct area in which the population of any of the following categories of individuals is higher than the average populations of such category for the State in which the community is located:

subparagraph.text: Black.
African American.
Asian.
Pacific Islander.
Other non-White race.
Hispanic.
Latino.
Linguistically isolated.
Middle Eastern and North African.

paragraph.text: The term critically underserved community means—

subparagraph.text: a community that can demonstrate to the Secretary that the community has inadequate, insufficient, or no park space or recreation facilities, including by demonstrating—

clause.text: quality concerns relating to the available park space or recreation facilities;
the presence of recreational facilities that do not serve the needs of the community; or
the inequitable distribution of park space for high-need populations based on income, age, or other measures of vulnerability and need;

subparagraph.text: a community in which at least 50 percent of the population is not located within 1⁄2 mile of park space;
an environmental justice community; or
any other community that the Secretary determines to be appropriate.

paragraph.text: The term designated service area means a geographical area recommended by a designated official planning agency that defines the community in which coordinated transportation services are provided to the transportation disadvantaged.

subparagraph.text: a State;
a political subdivision of a State (including a city or a county) that represents or otherwise serves an urban area or a rural area;
a special purpose district (including a park district);
an Indian Tribe (as defined in section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304)) that represents or otherwise serves an urban area or a rural area; or
a metropolitan planning organization (as defined in section 134(b) of title 23, United States Code).

paragraph.text: The term environmental justice community means a community with significant representation of communities of color, low-income communities, or Tribal or indigenous communities that experiences, or is at risk of experiencing, a disproportionate burden of adverse human health or environmental effects.
The term low-income community means any census block group in which 30 percent or more of the population are individuals with an annual household income equal to, or less than, the greater of—

subparagraph.text: an amount equal to 80 percent of the median income of the area in which the household is located, as reported by the Department of Housing and Urban Development; or
200 percent of the Federal poverty line.

paragraph.text: The term program means the Transit to Trails Grant Program established under subsection (b)(1).
The term rural area means a community that is not an urban area.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Transportation.

subparagraph.text: The term transportation connector means a system that—

clause.text: connects 2 ZIP Codes or communities within a 175-mile radius of a designated service area; and
offers rides available to the public.

subparagraph.text: The term transportation connector includes microtransits, bus lines, bus rails, light rail, rapid transits, or personal rapid transits.

paragraph.text: The term urban area means a community that—

subparagraph.text: is densely developed;
has residential, commercial, and other nonresidential areas; and
is—

clause.text: an urbanized area with a population of 50,000 or more; or
an urban cluster with a population of—

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall establish a grant program, to be known as the Transit to Trails Grant Program, under which the Secretary shall award grants to eligible entities for—

subparagraph.text: projects that develop transportation connectors or routes in or serving, and related culturally and linguistically appropriate education materials for, critically underserved communities to increase access and mobility to Federal or non-Federal public land, waters, parkland, or monuments; or
projects that facilitate transportation improvements to enhance access to Federal or non-Federal public land and recreational opportunities in critically underserved communities.

The Secretary shall administer the program to assist eligible entities in the development of transportation connectors or routes in or serving, and related culturally and linguistically appropriate education materials for, critically underserved communities and Federal or non-Federal public land, waters, parkland, and monuments.

The Secretary shall encourage joint partnership projects under the program, if available, among multiple agencies, including school districts, nonprofit organizations, metropolitan planning organizations, regional transportation authorities, transit agencies, and State and local governmental agencies (including park and recreation agencies and authorities) to enhance investment of public sources.

subparagraph.header: Annual grant project proposal solicitation, review, and approval

clause.text: The Secretary shall—

subclause.text: annually solicit the submission of project proposals for grants from eligible entities under the program; and
review each project proposal submitted under subclause (I) on a timeline established by the Secretary.

clause.text: A project proposal submitted under clause (i)(I) shall include—

subclause.text: a statement of the purposes of the project;
the name of the entity or individual with overall responsibility for the project;
a description of the qualifications of the entity or individuals identified under subclause (II);

item.text: staffing and stakeholder engagement for the project;
the logistics of the project; and

subclause.text: a proposed budget for the funds and time required to complete the project;
information regarding the source and amount of matching funding available for the project;
information that demonstrates the clear potential of the project to contribute to increased access to parkland for critically underserved communities; and
any other information that the Secretary considers to be necessary for evaluating the eligibility of the project for funding under the program.

subparagraph.text: To the extent practicable, in determining whether to approve project proposals under the program, the Secretary shall prioritize projects that—

clause.text: are designed to increase access and mobility to local or neighborhood Federal or non-Federal public land, waters, parkland, monuments, or recreational opportunities;
utilize low- or no-emission vehicles;
provide free or discounted rates for low-income riders;
provide opportunities for youth engagement;
provide employment preference to individuals who reside in the community where the project is granted;
are established in communities of color, low-income communities, Tribal or indigenous communities, or rural areas;
would capitalize on existing established public-private partnerships; and
comply with relevant regulations issued under the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12101 et seq.).

subparagraph.text: In consultation with the head of each appropriate Federal land management agency, the Secretary shall develop, by rule, transportation planning procedures for projects conducted under the program that are consistent with metropolitan and statewide planning processes.
In carrying out the program, the Secretary shall ensure the following:

clause.text: All projects carried out under the program shall comply with sections 5303 and 5304 of title 49, United States Code.

All new transportation connectors and routes established under a project carried out under the program shall be accessible in accordance with the accessibility specifications for transportation vehicles under the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12101 et seq.).

State department of transportation agencies shall engage with relevant stakeholders consistent with sections 5304(f)(3) and 5404(g)(3) of title 49, United States Code, and metropolitan planning organizations shall engage with relevant stakeholders consistent with sections 5303(g)(3)(B), 5303(i)(5), and 5303(i)(6) of title 49, United States Code, in addition to faith-based and community-based organizations.
Except as otherwise provided under this section, a grant provided under this section shall be subject to the requirements of section 5307 of title 49, United States Code.

subparagraph.text: The Federal share of the cost of a project carried out under the program shall not exceed 80 percent.
The non-Federal share of the cost of a project carried out under the program may be derived from in-kind contributions.

paragraph.text: Grant funds provided under the program may be used—

subparagraph.text: to develop transportation connectors or routes in or serving, and related culturally and linguistically appropriate education materials for, critically underserved communities to increase access and mobility to Federal and non-Federal public land, waters, parkland, and monuments; and
to create or significantly enhance access to Federal or non-Federal public land and recreational opportunities in an urban area or a rural area.

paragraph.text: A grant provided under the program shall be—

subparagraph.text: not less than $25,000; and
not more than $500,000.

paragraph.text: It is the intent of Congress that grants provided under the program deliver project funds to areas of greatest need while offering technical assistance to all applicants and potential applicants for grant preparation to encourage full participation in the program.

The Secretary shall ensure that current schedules and routes for transportation systems developed after the receipt of a grant under the program are available to the public, including on a website maintained by the recipient of a grant.
The Secretary shall require a recipient of a grant under the program to submit to the Secretary at least 1 performance and financial report that—

subparagraph.text: includes—

clause.text: demographic data on communities served by the project; and
a summary of project activities conducted after receiving the grant; and

subparagraph.text: describes the status of each project funded by the grant as of the date of the report.

paragraph.text: In addition to the report required under paragraph (1), the Secretary may require additional reports from a recipient, as the Secretary determines to be appropriate, including a final report.
The Secretary shall establish deadlines for the submission of each report required under paragraph (1) or (2).

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $10,000,000 for the first and second fiscal years that begin after the date of enactment of this Act, $20,000,000 for the third and fourth fiscal year beginning after such date, and $40,000,000 for the fifth fiscal year beginning after such date.
